metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Vue gives us an easy way to improve the user experience with forms by adding extra functionality like responsiveness and form validation.
content.html: Vue gives us an easy way to improve the user experience with forms by adding extra functionality like responsiveness and form validation.

content.text: Vue uses the v-model directive when handling forms.
content.html: Vue uses the v-model directive when handling forms.

content.text: Lets start with a simple shopping list example to see how Vue can be used when creating a form.
content.html: Lets start with a simple shopping list example to see how Vue can be used when creating a form.

content.text: For more information about forms in HTML, with related tags and attributes, see our HTML Forms tutorial .
content.html: For more information about forms in HTML, with related tags and attributes, see our HTML Forms tutorial.

content.code:
Add item

Item name:

How many:
content.code_html:
<form>
  <p>Add item</p>
  <p>Item name: <input type="text" required></p>
  <p>How many: <input type="number"></p>
  <button type="submit">Add item</button>
</form>

content.text: 2. Create the Vue instance with the current item name, number and the shopping list, and use v-model to connect our inputs to it.
content.html: 2. Create the Vue instance with the current item name, number and the shopping list, and use v-model to connect our inputs to it.

content.code:
Add item

Item name:

How many:
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <form>
    <p>Add item</p>
    <p>Item name: <input type="text" required v-model="itemName"></p>
    <p>How many: <input type="number" v-model="itemNumber"></p>
    <button type="submit">Add item</button>
  </form>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        itemName: null,
        itemNumber: null,
        shoppingList: [
          { name: 'Tomatoes', number: 5 }
        ]
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: 3. Call the method to add an item to the shopping list, and prevent the default browser refresh on submit.
content.html: 3. Call the method to add an item to the shopping list, and prevent the default browser refresh on submit.

content.code_html: <form v-on:submit.prevent="addItem">

content.text: 4. Create the method that adds the item to the shopping list, and clears the form:
content.html: 4. Create the method that adds the item to the shopping list, and clears the form:

content.code_html:
methods: {
  addItem() {
    let item = {
      name: this.itemName,
      number: this.itemNumber
      }
    this.shoppingList.push(item);
    this.itemName = null
    this.itemNumber = null
  }
}

content.text: 5. Use v-for to show an automatically updated shopping list below the form:
content.html: 5. Use v-for to show an automatically updated shopping list below the form:

content.code_html:
<p>Shopping list:</p>
<ul>
  <li v-for="item in shoppingList">{{item.name}}, {{item.number}}</li>
</ul>

content.text: Below is the final code for our first Vue form.
content.html: Below is the final code for our first Vue form.

content.code:
Add item

Item name:

How many:

Shopping list:

  • {{item.name}}, {{item.number}}
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  <form v-on:submit.prevent="addItem">
    <p>Add item</p>
    <p>Item name: <input type="text" required v-model="itemName"></p>
    <p>How many: <input type="number" v-model="itemNumber"></p>
    <button type="submit">Add item</button>
  </form>

  <p>Shopping list:</p>
  <ul>
    <li v-for="item in shoppingList">{{item.name}}, {{item.number}}</li>
  </ul>
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        itemName: null,
        itemNumber: null,
        shoppingList: [
          { name: 'Tomatoes', number: 5 }
        ]
      }
    },
    methods: {
      addItem() {
        let item = {
          name: this.itemName,
          number: this.itemNumber
        }
        this.shoppingList.push(item)
        this.itemName = null
        this.itemNumber = null
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: Notice the two-way binding v-model provides in the example above:
content.html: Notice the two-way binding v-model provides in the example above:

content.text: To learn more about v-model and see more form examples, click 'Next'.
content.html: To learn more about v-model and see more form examples, click 'Next'.
